intro: Tanghinia laurifolia, commonly known as the laurel-leaf tanghinia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
